Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of elective procedures on the rise in hospitalizations due to COVID-19.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it fails to provide evidence or data to back up the assertion that elective procedures are the main cause of the increase in hospitalizations.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the rise in hospitalizations is solely due to elective procedures being permitted, without considering other factors such as the spread of COVID-19.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores alternative explanations for the rise in hospitalizations, such as the increase in COVID-19 cases and the strain on healthcare systems.
